channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: WBD、広告なしのDiscovery+を米国で月額6.99ドルから8.99ドルに、カナダで6.99カナダドルから8.99カナダドルに値上げ。
item.description:
Todd Spangler / Variety:
WBD hikes the price of Discovery+ without ads in the US from $6.99 to $8.99 per month and Canada from CA$6.99 to CA$8.99; ad-tier remains $4.99/month in the US  —  It's the first time Discovery+ has increased the price of a monthly subscription in the markets since launching in January 2021.

item.title: 麻薬暴力と政府腐敗を報道していたジャーナリスト2人が殺害され、閉鎖されたメキシコのニュースメディア「Monitor Michoacán」を見てみよう（Nicholas Casey/New York Times）。
item.description:
Nicholas Casey / New York Times:
A look at Monitor Michoacán, a Mexican news outlet that closed after two of its journalists reporting on drug violence and government corruption were murdered  —  Drug violence and government corruption have put the country's journalists in peril.  In one town, reporters tried to fight back.

item.title: マイケル・ルイスのプロフィール。新著『Going Infinite』について、SBFを本質的に本物だと考える理由、『ブラインド・サイド』論争などについて語る（Samanth Subramanian/The Guardian）。
item.description:
Samanth Subramanian / The Guardian:
A profile of Michael Lewis, as he talks about his new book, Going Infinite, why he considers SBF to be essentially genuine, The Blind Side controversy, and more  —  As author of The Big Short and Moneyball, Michael Lewis is perhaps the most celebrated journalist of his generation.

item.title: テイラー・ロレンツの新著『Extremely Online』、インターネット構築における女性の役割、ジャーナリズムに対するニューメディアの影響、ツイッター、スレッドなどについてのQ&A（Hanaa' Tameez/Nieman Lab）。
item.description:
Hanaa' Tameez / Nieman Lab:
Q&A with Taylor Lorenz on her new book, Extremely Online, women's role in building the internet, new media's effect on journalism, Twitter, Threads, and more  —  “The personality-driven model of news is not going away.”  —  In 2017, Taylor Lorenz predicted for Nieman Lab that selfie journalism would become “a thing.”

item.title: RIAA：2023年上半期の米国におけるラテン系レコード音楽収入は14.8%増の$627M、これに対し米国全体の収入は9.3%増、ラテン系ストリーミング収入は16%増(Stuart Dredge/Music Ally)
item.description:
Stuart Dredge / Music Ally:
The RIAA: Latin recorded music revenue in the US grew 14.8% to $627M in H1 2023, compared to overall US revenue growth of 9.3%; Latin streaming revenue grew 16%  —  One of the trends in recent years has been the fact that however fast recorded-music revenues grew in the US, Latin recorded music revenues grew faster.

item.title: 元ワシントン・ポスト紙編集長マーティ・バロンの著書、トランプからの圧力、スティール文書を共有しないこと、ジャーナリストの言論の自由などについてQ&A（James Rainey/Los Angeles Times）。
item.description:
James Rainey / Los Angeles Times:
Q&A with former Washington Post editor Marty Baron on his book, pressure from Trump, not sharing the Steele Dossier, journalists' free speech rights, and more  —  Former Washington Post editor Martin Baron joins the L.A. Times Book Club Oct. 11 to discuss “Collision of Power,” …

item.title: 米判事は、ディズニーがHuluとESPNの所有権を利用してライブTVストリーミングのコストを吊り上げているとして、独占禁止法違反の訴訟を起こされた。
item.description:
Winston Cho / The Hollywood Reporter:
A US judge rules that Disney must face an antitrust lawsuit accusing the company of inflating the cost of streaming live TV using its ownership of Hulu and ESPN  —  YouTube TV subscribers filed a class action lawsuit accusing Disney of essentially operating the business as a single entity …

item.title: 情報筋パラマウントは、2023年にインドでParamount+を開始する計画を中止し、提携先のJioCinemaに多くの番組を販売することを検討している（Sohee Kim/Bloomberg）
item.description:
Sohee Kim / Bloomberg:
Sources: Paramount is considering scrapping its plans to launch Paramount+ in India in 2023 in favor of selling more programming to its partner JioCinema  —  - Many media companies reconsider their international spending  — Low-priced competition makes a costly launch less appealing

item.title: 現在閉鎖中のアップル・デイリー社のオーナーであり、香港で最も率直な民主化運動家の一人であるジミー・ライの獄中生活1000日を迎えてのプロフィール（Amy Hawkins/The Guardian）
item.description:
Amy Hawkins / The Guardian:
A profile of Jimmy Lai, the owner of now closed Apple Daily and one of Hong Kong's most outspoken pro-democracy activists, as he marks 1,000 days in prison  —  He went from rags to riches before his anti-communist newspaper fell foul of security forces.  Now Lai's plight tells of a city forced …

item.title: Spotifyアプリの最新ビルドに含まれるコードによると、同社はユーザーのプロンプトに基づいてAIが生成するプレイリストに取り組んでおり、おそらく英語のみで利用できる（Sarah Perez/TechCrunch）
item.description:
Sarah Perez / TechCrunch:
Code in the latest build of the Spotify app suggests the company is working on AI-generated playlists based on users' prompts, likely available in English only  —  Following the successful launch of Spotify's AI-powered DJ feature and, more recently, added support for AI-translated podcasts …

item.title: 削除されたディープフェイク詐欺のTikTok広告に自分の肖像が使われていたMrBeastが、ソーシャルメディア・プラットフォームは「AIディープフェイクの台頭に対応する準備ができているのか」と質問（Kalhan Rosenblatt/NBC News）
item.description:
Kalhan Rosenblatt / NBC News:
MrBeast asks whether social media platforms are “ready to handle the rise of AI deepfakes” after a deepfake scam TikTok ad, since deleted, used his likeness  —  MrBeast, whose real name is Jimmy Donaldson, called the rise of AI deepfakes “a serious problem” in response to a fake ad circulating online.

item.title: スポティファイ、プレミアム会員に月15時間、15万タイトル以上のオーディオブックストリーミングを提供開始。
item.description:
New York Times:
Spotify starts offering Premium subscribers 15 hours of audiobook streaming per month across 150K+ titles, first in the UK and Australia, and the US this winter  —  A year after adding à la carte sales of audiobooks, Spotify is offering paying subscribers 15 hours of books a month.

item.title: アトランタ・ジャーナル・コンスティテューションの発行人兼社長アンドリュー・モースが、2026年までにデジタル購読者を6万人から50万人に増やすという目標について語ったインタビュー（Sophie Culpepper/Nieman Lab）。
item.description:
Sophie Culpepper / Nieman Lab:
An interview with Atlanta Journal-Constitution Publisher and President Andrew Morse, on the goal of growing its digital subscribers from ~60K to 500K by 2026  —  “We want to cloak ourselves in all things Atlanta.  And frankly, in recent years, we haven't necessarily done that."

item.title: 19世紀風のレトロな外観、広告なし、アメリカに焦点を当てた年6回発行の8.50ドルの印刷専用新聞「カウンティ・ハイウェイ」を見てみよう（Dalya Alberge/The Guardian）
item.description:
Dalya Alberge / The Guardian:
A look at County Highway, a new, $8.50 print-only newspaper published six times a year with a retro 19th-century look, no advertising, and a focus on the US  —  The retro-look County Highway costs $8.50, is published six times a year - and will never be available online

item.title: ガーディアン』紙、『ミラー』紙、『リーチ』サイト、『ナショナル』紙がダン・ウートンに関する記事の一部を削除、情報筋によるとウートンの弁護士による警告に従った動きとのこと（Dominic Ponsford/Press Gazette）
item.description:
Dominic Ponsford / Press Gazette:
The Guardian, The Mirror, Reach sites, and The National take down some stories about Dan Wootton; a source says the moves follow a warning by Wootton's lawyer  —  Publishers threatened with exemplary damages and punitive costs.  —  The Guardian, Mirror, various other Reach sites and Newsquest's …
